title: CryptopreneurBrainboss
author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
created_time: May 12, 2023, 10:47:34 PMLast edit: May 12, 2023, 11:22:13 PM by CryptopreneurBrainboss
content: My people, if you dun run transaction in the last one week, you go dun see say miners dun turn POS operative in regards to the kind transaction fee dem dey charge. To get transaction confirm in the fastest time dey cost reach like $200 last week as I dey see screenshots everywhere (like the screenshot above wey person been send me) even me self check am and confirm am. People wey been get all their money for BTC the thing worry dem well well. How far, you do transaction last week and if yes how much you pay for fee. Also which wallet wey you use run the transaction so maybe others fit download incase this kind thing repeat him self for future. Edit: I notice those wey dey use trustwallet dey get this over high fee issue as dem no get control over setting their fees Another matta wey I wan bring here na, from this experience of high fees na say, wetin be your stand on getting some stablecoin for hand as e fit help in situations like this. People wey been get stablecoin just dey do their things as normal like nothing happen and dey wait for the fee to come down (e dun reduce small now) before dem begin the use the network again. How you see the idea to they hold stablecoin as you dey hold your BTC.

comments.body: Quote from: CryptopreneurBrainboss on May 12, 2023, 10:47:34 PMTo get transaction confirm in the fastest time dey cost reach like $200 last week as I dey see screenshots everywhere (like the screenshot above wey person been send me) even me self check am and confirm am.The highest fee that I noticed at 500 sat/vbyte for 1 input 2 outputs for native segwit to native segwit addresses was around $23, if bitcoin is at $28000.Probably he used a wallet that has a wrong fee estimation as that is not up to $50 for legacy address to legacy address which can possibly has the highest fee for 1 input and 2 outputs.Or the transaction has many inputs and/or many outputs. It is good to consolidate inputs if mempool is not congested.Quote from: CryptopreneurBrainboss on May 12, 2023, 10:47:34 PMAlso which wallet wey you use run the transaction so maybe others fit download incase this kind thing repeat him self for future.Desktop Electrum has fee customization. Bluewallet wallet that is available on Android, iOS and MacOS has fee customization as well.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Omo.. I no go lie, the last past few weeks have been both a hell and blessing in disguise to me, in the sense that I was able to save more and spend less unlike before that if I need small money, ah go just run Btc transfer and swap am immediately to fiat in less than 10minutes. But I swear, has few weeks did actually show me shege, as you dey see say you get rubbers oh, but yet no fit transfer or swap an into fiat due to very high transaction fee. Because I fit remember trying to transfer my fund from Trust Wallet (I.e my first campaign BTC wallet address and I yet still maintaining it) to Remitano, and I noticed that the fee to transfer #12,000 was #3000 (i.e something wey dey cost #260 before oh), and I stopped, hoping that next day fee go don drop back to normal, but only for me to check and I noticed say fee done skyrocket 4x from #3000 to be #10,000 as fee oh to transfer that same amount of #12000.Check out belowBut it was just of recently I noticed that you can equally select the amount of fee you wish to pay while using "Trust wallet" (i.e after the fee fell back to around #1500), as you can see in the arrow given in the image below, as that button is meant for fee, and it can be used to reduce or increase your Bitcoin transaction fee on trust wallet. And that was how I was able to reduce my fee from #1325 to #500 on Monday 15th May, transferred and got it confirmed in less than an hour.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: I will always advice Nigerians to stop using Trustwallet for bitcoin, it is one of the worst bitcoin wallet that I have seen.@CryptoHeadlineNewsI like it that you are estimation your coins and fee in naira, but did you know that the exchanges and wallets that I have seen naira, including Binance and Trustwallet are all using CBN (official) rate? Which is 461 as of today. The last parallel (black) market price of United States dollar to Nigerian naira was 753. That can be misleading. You are not wrong, but I am just saying.
